reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As far as I can recall, this was probably only the second parador that we’ve ever stayed in (the other being the modern one in Ronda which we liked very much), though we’ve eaten in several more. It was nice enough but something of a letdown after the wonderful Villa Rosario in Ribadesella. It’s starting to fray a bit about the edges and could use some freshening up, especially in the rooms where floors could use resurfacing. The amount of space OTOH is amazing. For 154 euros including tax and breakfast on a “Golden Days” special promotion based on our age—how discriminatory but I’ll take it, we had not only a bedroom but also a very large living room, a walk-in closet room, a sun porch with windows onto the estuary and two full bathrooms. Food in the dining room was ok but nothing to write about. Breakfast there was plentiful but not as good as Vincci Puerto Chico in Santander where the tortilla was head and shoulders better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this Parador for one night. We had stayed in Santiago for three nights in a superb 5 star hotel and were very disappointed with this Parador. The staff were extremely unfriendly when we arrived. We were given a room without a view and it was very small. The bathroom was small and pretty sparse. Ribadeo itself was very disappointing apart from a couple of interesting old buildings in the square. We did have an amazing meal at a restaurant near the front (Restaurante Marinero), it specialises in fish and was very reasonable and the food was superb. The restaurant opens at 8.30 and it is obviously very popular as it was very busy. The only plus point about the Parador was the breakfast which was excellent and there were a lot of choices - hot and cold. I would not go back to Ribadeo.
reviews.title: Pretty Average Parador
Highlight of northern Spain
reviews.text: Ribadeo is a distinctly non-touristy quiet town just inside Galicia in a rather well-placed location on high ground overlooking a broad river inlet. This lovely parador , about which our guide book was unreasonably dismissive, has nice spacious rooms with great views over the expanse of water and the Asturian towns on the other side. The play of light at various times is very absorbing and makes for a relaxing and contemplative time sitting looking out the window.
